dt.core

Class AbstractDecisionTreeLearner

  • java.lang.Object
    • dt.core.AbstractDecisionTreeLearner
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DecisionTreeLearner

    public abstract class AbstractDecisionTreeLearner
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides a skeletal implementation of the decision-tree learning algorithm in AIMA Fig 18.5, which is based on ID3 (see AIMA p. 758). It also provides implementations for some of the trickier methods used in the information gain calculations used to select variables for splitting (AIMA Sect. 18.3.4).

      protected double gain_boolean(Variable a, Variable outputVar, java.util.Set<Example> examples)
      Return the ``information gain from an attribute test on A,'' which is ``the expected reduction in entropy.'' (AIMA p704)
      protected double gain(Variable a, java.util.Set<Example> examples)
      For set of examples T, attribute (variable) a with values vk, and Ek = subset of T for which a=vk: IG(T,a) = H(T) - \sum_vk { |Ek|/|T| * H(Ek) } This is the general case of the Boolean version done in AIMA.
      protected double H(java.util.Set<Example> examples)
      Return the entropy of the output variable using the given set of Examples.

      Return the entropy of the given Variable computing the probabilities of its values from the given Examples.

      Compute and return a DecisionTree for this DecisionTreeLearner's Problem using the given Set of Examples.

      • learn

        protected abstract DecisionTree learn(java.util.Set<Example> examples,
                                      java.util.List<Variable> attributes,
                                      java.util.Set<Example> parent_examples)
        Main recursive decision-tree learning (ID3) method. This must be implemented by subclasses.

      • pluralityValue

        protected abstract java.lang.String pluralityValue(java.util.Set<Example> examples)
        Returns the most common output value among a set of Examples, breaking ties randomly (or not--it may not matter to you).

      • uniqueOutputValue

        protected abstract java.lang.String uniqueOutputValue(java.util.Set<Example> examples)
        Returns the single unique output value among the given examples is there is only one, otherwise null.

      • mostImportantVariable

        protected Variable mostImportantVariable(java.util.List<Variable> attributes,
                                         java.util.Set<Example> examples)
        Return the variable with the maximum information gain based on the given examples, per AIMA Section 18.3.4. Note that this is not cheap to compute...

      • gain_boolean

        protected double gain_boolean(Variable a,
                              Variable outputVar,
                              java.util.Set<Example> examples)
        Return the ``information gain from an attribute test on A,'' which is ``the expected reduction in entropy.'' (AIMA p704)

      • remainder_boolean

        protected double remainder_boolean(Variable a,
                                   Variable outputVar,
                                   java.util.Set<Example> examples,
                                   int p,
                                   int n)
        Return the ``expected entropy remaining after testing attribute A.'' (AIMA p704) We pass in p and n from gain() to avoid recomputing them. AIMA doesn't say what to do if Ek is empty. We skip it.

      • B

        protected double B(double q)
        Return the entropy of a Boolean random variable that is true with probability q. (AIMA p. 704) AIMA doesn't say what to do when q=0 or 1, but since log2(0)=-Infinity we have to do something... using 0 matches their results. Not used in the general procedure, only in the AIMA Boolean example.

      • countPositiveExamples

        protected int countPositiveExamples(java.util.Set<Example> examples)
        Return the number of examples with "Yes" for the output value. Not used in the general case, just the AIMA Boolean example.

      • H

        protected double H(Variable var,
                   java.util.Set<Example> examples)
        Return the entropy of the given Variable computing the probabilities of its values from the given Examples. For variable V with values vk: H(V) = \sum_k P(vk)*log_2(1/P(vk)) = -\sum_k P(vk)*log_2(Pvk)

      • H

        protected double H(java.util.Set<Example> examples)
        Return the entropy of the output variable using the given set of Examples.

      • gain

        protected double gain(Variable a,
                      java.util.Set<Example> examples)
        For set of examples T, attribute (variable) a with values vk, and Ek = subset of T for which a=vk: IG(T,a) = H(T) - \sum_vk { |Ek|/|T| * H(Ek) } This is the general case of the Boolean version done in AIMA.

      • remainder

        protected double remainder(Variable a,
                           java.util.Set<Example> examples)
        Return the expected entropy remaining after testing attribute a. This is the general case of the Boolean version done in AIMA.

      • log2

        protected double log2(double x)
        Return log base 2 of the given number.

      • examplesWithValueForAttribute

        protected abstract java.util.Set<Example> examplesWithValueForAttribute(java.util.Set<Example> examples,
                                                                        Variable a,
                                                                        java.lang.String vk)
        Return the subset of the given examples for which Variable a has value vk.
